info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 2:52PM CDT until June 13 at 1:02AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Leon Creek At I-35S near San Antonio affecting Bexar County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Leon Creek at I-35S near San Antonio.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Major flooding could reach or enter structures above Kelly USA down to I-35. Several horse barns are flooded. Roads, streets and low bridges in the flood plain and near Leon Creek can flood and become dangerous and deadly. The northbound and southbound medians to the I-35 bridge and service roads will begin to flood. Flooding will begin around the StandardAero facility.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 PM CDT Thursday was 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 19.8 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 1.4 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 3.4 feet late Monday morning. It will then fall to 3.2 feet Monday afternoon. It will rise to 3.4 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 12/21/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 115 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
